page.title: 05PEAT: USES OF.
page.content: {Peat}is used for all kinds of different things.It is formed from {sphagnum moss}which grows abundently in the wet boggy conditions. Peat is used for{fuel,}and as recently as early the first half of the Twentieth Century, it was one of the main sources of{domestic fuel. Presently, it is enjoying something of a{comeback}as the price of other fuels soars. It is also used as a{growing {medium}for hanging baskets,grow bags etc; it is used for{packing}potatoes and also for catching eggs safely in factory farms. There are{two peat works}near Crowle.The larger one is run by Fisons. A smaller one is operated by Mr.Ken Crow, who processes the peat at Medge Hall, about two miles away.
